text: Solidago erecta is a species of goldenrod known by the common names showy goldenrod and slender goldenrod. It is native to the eastern United States, from Massachusetts west to Indiana, and south as far as Georgia and Mississippi.Biota of North America Program 2014 county distribution map Solidago erecta is a perennial herb up to 120 cm (4 feet) tall. One plant can produce as many as 350 small yellow flower heads in an elongated array.Flora of North America, Solidago erecta Banks ex Pursh, 1813. Slender goldenrod ==References== ==External links== erecta Category:Flora of the Eastern United States Category:Plants described in 1813
title: Solidago erecta
